intro: Ortholoma calotrichum, commonly known as the California buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces delicate, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture and are often covered in fine hairs. Ortholoma calotrichum is adapted to dry, sunny habitats and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
